isis.stitle: ANTILOCK BRAKES/ TRACTION CONTROL TROUBLESHOOTING: BENDIX - 9100, 9200, 9300 and 9400 Models Built March 1, 1998 and After - TROUBLESHOOTING - DIAGNOSTICS

svcprocinfo.para:
All troubleshooting begins by observing the ABS Warning Light and the Traction Active Light located on the instrument panel. While the service tool locates a specific problem area, it is necessary to confirm whether the problem is in the component or the connecting circuits. The diagnostic tables, beginning with INITIAL START-UP TEST PROCEDURE
, guide the technician to the specific fault.

step1.para: Determine if the vehicle has traction control installed. With traction control there will be a Traction Active light and ON/OFF switch on the instrument panel
Place the traction control ON/OFF switch in the ON position, before beginning troubleshooting.

Begin the troubleshooting process by performing INITIAL START-UP TEST PROCEDURE
.
The service technician should record all findings and action taken during troubleshooting.

No voltage or resistance tests are performed into the controller. Caution - Do not perform tests on the controller. All tests in this manual will be on the vehicle harness side of controller connectors (350) and (355).
